node.title: House Dems Take Aim at Richest Americans' Retirement Accounts in New Biden Plan Addition
node.description: "IRAs were designed to provide retirement security to middle-class families, not allow the super-wealthy to avoid paying taxes," Senator Ron Wyden said.

node.title: 'A greater awareness of our fragility': John Bell on the role of cultural leaders and the arts after COVID
node.description: It's six years since Bell stepped down from the company he co-founded, but the octogenarian actor is showing no signs of slowing down.

node.title: Sad decline of 'athletic, talented' child detailed in coroner's report
node.description: Tasmania's coroner reveals the harrowing story of a man who began life as an "athletic and talented child" but who died, aged 36, from complications of morbid obesity after suffering a long battle with mental illness.

node.title: After two years of pandemic pain, hope is shining for these year 12 students
node.description: Many of them have weathered one of the longest periods of lockdown in the world. Now, Victoria's class of 2021 is graduating, with some hard-earned wisdom from their extraordinary final years at school.

node.title: It took authorities months to act when part of an iconic Great Ocean Road town's surf club washed away
node.description: The Wye River Surf Life Saving Club lost a $150,000 ramp when the river diverted and water lapped at the building, and locals are frustrated by how slow authorities were to respond.

node.title: Kylie was against getting vaccinated. But something changed her mind.
node.description: Tasmania is about to reach a significant COVID-19 vaccination milestone, with 90 per cent of the state's population over 16 having had at least one dose. But as the state moves closer to opening, vaccination rates for a vulnerable section of the population is lagging.

node.title: Victorian government to 'make illegal logging legal' after tweak to laws
node.description: Victoria's water catchments will now have fewer protections against logging, after a change to the legislation by the Andrews government which will allow the practice in previously off-limits areas.

node.title: When missing children return: How can we avoid adding to Cleo Smith's trauma?
node.description: The miraculous rescue of four-year-old Cleo Smith prompted a nationwide sigh of relief this week. Now it's time to ensure the aftermath of the ordeal doesn't add to her trauma, writes Louise Newman.

node.title: House Democrats Hunt for Votes to Pass Biden’s Domestic Agenda
node.description: Speaker Nancy Pelosi wants a vote as soon as Thursday night on a $1.85 trillion social policy and climate bill, but moderates are pushing back.

node.title: 'The Worst Campaign I've Ever Been Involved In': Democrats Blast McAuliffe In Virginia
node.description: "Latinos and Blacks, who have been overwhelmingly hit hard by the pandemic and feel incredible economic anxiety have no idea what Democrats in Virginia have done to make their lives better. They don't know what Terry was going to do or what Biden has done."

node.title: Lawyers Rip Nearly All-White Jury in Ahmaud Arbery Trial as Judge Cites 'Discrimination'
node.description: The defense team for Gregory McMichael, Travis McMichael and William "Roddie" Bryan used 11 of its strikes to remove all but one of the Black juror candidates.

node.title: Customers allege Hertz had them falsely arrested: "Just terrifying"
node.description: The car rental giant, which recently emerged from bankruptcy, insists virtually all of the claims are "meritless" and says they should not be allowed to proceed for various technical reasons.

node.title: Automakers Working on Cars That Will Pull Over if Driver Has Heart Attack or Stroke
node.description: The car would also make an emergency call to the police and an ambulance, honk its horn, and flash the blinker and hazard lights to alert others nearby.

node.title: Hungary Official Admits Government Used Spyware to Target Journalists, Businesspeople
node.description: Lajos Kosa insisted there was no illegal activity and that officials received permission from courts or the Ministry of Justice before using Pegasus.

node.title: Covid-19 'just got real' in Te Tai Tokerau
node.description: One in five people are still unvaccinated in Northland and there are now 10 active cases in the region.

node.title: Jay-Z deletes his Instagram
node.description: He became the only person Beyoncé followed. Now she follows nobody.

node.title: Judge to rule "expeditiously" on Trump's bid to shield records from House
node.description: Attorneys representing Mr. Trump, the House of Representatives and the National Archives argued in federal court Thursday.

node.title: Over 100 million Americans under cold weather warnings
node.description: The cool temperatures are expected to return to normal by the end of the weekend.

node.title: Will the newly vaccinated in the U.S. be protected for the holidays? The calendar is tight.
node.description: Younger children in the U.S. who are now getting their first shots of the Pfizer-BioNTech vaccine will not reach full protection until after Thanksgiving.

node.title: 13 New Books We Recommend This Week
node.description: Suggested reading from critics and editors at The New York Times.

node.title: 'Pushed to Breaking Points': Chipotle Store Forced to Close After Half of Staff Walks Out
node.description: The temporary closure comes just one day after staff walked out of a New York Chipotle due to being overwhelmed by a $5 bowl offer.

node.title: Viral Clip of Fast Food Restaurant Paying $20 an Hour Ignites Debate Over 'Livable Wages'
node.description: Comments were split over the amount of money employees were seeing in their paychecks.

node.title: Elon Musk Trolls Jeff Bezos After Losing NASA Lawsuit Over Blue Origin Space Contract
node.description: Bezos and Blue Origin first filed the lawsuit against NASA in August, after the space agency chose Musk's SpaceX to develop a Human Landing System to bring astronauts to the moon.

node.title: Pricey Bottle of Japanese Whisky Gifted to Pompeo Among Items Missing From State Dept. Vault
node.description: A 22-karat gold coin worth $560 was also reported as missing along with the nearly $6,000 bottle of Suntory Hibiki whisky.

node.title: Covid-19 wrap: Govt works on options for holiday travel
node.description: The possibility of a border system to allow vaccinated Aucklanders to travel outside the region over summer has split officials.

node.title: The hip hop dancer and ex-All Black working together for young South Aucklanders
node.description: As Auckland heads into day 80 of lockdown, a free virtual event for young people in the south of the city is offering not just an escape from the monotony, but a chance to discover a new creative…

node.title: California woman survives bear attack inside Lake Tahoe cabin
node.description: Laurel-Rose Von Hoffmann-Curzi suffered injuries to her face, chest and arms when a bear mauled her and she had to receive dozens of stitches, CBS station KPIX-TV reports.

node.title: With Climate Pledges, Some Wall Street Titans Warn of Rising Prices
node.description: Leaders of some of the world’s biggest financial firms say that the rush to transition to clean energy could have unintended consequences for the global economy.

node.title: 'How to Buy Squid Game Token' Still Trending Despite Crypto Crash and Scam Investigation
node.description: Crypto company Binance has labeled the project a scam after its value plummeted over 99 percent earlier this week.

node.title: Report Shows More Women Feel Burned Out, Consider Leaving Workforce
node.description: In the past year, one in three women thought about either leaving their jobs or "downshifting" their careers, according to the report.

node.title: National Candy Day 2021: The Best Deals and Offers For Sweet-Toothed Fiends
node.description: You may have already stocked up on candy thanks to Halloween's trick-or-treating, but many retailers have great deals this National Candy Day.

node.title: New Jersey College Removes Revolutionary War Veteran's Name From Alumni Building
node.description: The building had originally been named for a Revolutionary War veteran who owned slaves during the late 1700s.

node.title: Man Confronts Woman Who Allegedly Called Him a Racial Slur in Video Viewed 3M Times
node.description: The incident has sparked widespread support for the TikToker, as many have praised him for standing up to the woman.

node.title: 6-Month-Old Orphaned When Mom's Killed in Car Crash Months After Dad Dies of COVID
node.description: After losing her husband, Kera Leskovec wrote on Facebook their daughter would grow up hearing "amazing stories" about her dad.

node.title: Food Banks Expand Across U.S. as Need Remains Above Pre-Pandemic Levels
node.description: Feeding America's food banks provided a record amount of 6.6 billion meals between July of 2020 and June of 2021, up from 5.2 billion the previous year.

node.title: Dairy prices up 3.7 percent as commodity prices reach record high
node.description: Commodity prices have shot to a new record, with dairy, aluminium and meat fetching strong prices.

node.title: Mistaken identity shooting in Auckland: 'We're lucky we're not dealing with a homicide'
node.description: A witness to a shooting at an Auckland family home last night says it's a scary development on his normally quiet street.

node.title: ‘Hive’ Review: In the Aftermath of War, a Survivor Finds Herself
node.description: In a tough, taut drama, the director Blerta Basholli explores the lives of women whose husbands went missing in the Kosovo War.

node.title: A More Satisfying Meatless Meatball
node.description: Once you find the perfect base of beans, vegetables and grains, the possibilities are endless.

node.title: NIH Took Scientist's Word That Wuhan Research Wasn't Dangerous

node.title: Astronomers Say More Diversity Needed in Field as Men Greatly Outnumber Women: Survey
node.description: The report also urged NASA to treat harassment and discrimination "as forms of scientific misconduct."

node.title: ExxonMobil Is World's Most Obstructive Company on Climate Policy—Report
node.description: Of the top 25 biggest climate obstructors, 10 are based in the U.S.

node.title: Ahmaud Arbery Trial Has 11 White Jurors Despite Glynn County Being 25 Percent Black
node.description: In what is likely to be a racially charged trial, the jury will decide in the fate of defendants Gregory McMichael, his son Travis McMichael, and William Bryan.

node.title: Ghislaine Maxwell Trial Begins With Potential Jurors Asked About Sex Crimes, Knowledge of Case
node.description: The questionnaire consists of 51 questions primarily focused on the personal histories of the possible jurors and if they had posted an opinion on the case.

node.title: SCOTUS Second Amendment Hearing Signals Justices Think There Are Too Many Gun Control Laws
node.description: "A significant portion of the gun safety movement's current agenda is likely to come under attack in the coming years," UCLA's Adam Winkler said.

node.title: 12-Hour Police Chase, Highway Standoff in California Ends With Man in Custody
node.description: The alleged driver of the truck led authorities on a chase through several California counties, but came to a stop in Santa Ana on Thursday morning.

node.title: Truck Drivers, Facing Shortages, Expect More to Quit Over Biden Vaccine Mandate
node.description: The American Trucking Associations warned that the industry could lose as much as 37 percent of its workforce.

node.title: NASA’s Latest Breakthrough: ‘Best Space Tacos Yet’
node.description: For the first time, astronauts on the International Space Station cultivated chiles, adding some zing to their tacos.

node.title: The Atlanta Mayor’s Race Proceeds to a Runoff Without Kasim Reed
node.description: Two candidates, Felicia Moore and Andre Dickens, will compete in a runoff on Nov. 30.

node.title: Police Looking for Kidnapped Girl Tipped Off After Suspect Bought Diapers: Reports
node.description: Four-year-old Cleo Smith was said to be in high spirits after being reunited with her parents after her rescue.

node.title: How Much Does Daylight Saving Time Really Impact Health?
node.description: According to polls, four in 10 Americans don't like to change their clocks, while three in 10 Americans prefer to permanently stay on daylight saving time.

node.title: Marjorie Taylor Greene Claims Jan. 6 Detainees Are Being Abused in Jail
node.description: Investigators said prisoners, including those who allegedly took part in the riot at the Capitol, didn't need to be moved from a D.C. jail complex.

node.title: Emma Gilmour to race for McLaren
node.description: McLaren has announced New Zealander Emma Gilmour as their first female racer with the rally driver set to compete in Extreme E.

node.title: ‘Spencer’ Review: Prisoner of the House of Windsor
node.description: Kristen Stewart stars as an anguished, rebellious Princess Diana in Pablo Larraín’s answer to “The Crown.”

node.title: ‘Europe is back at the epicenter of the pandemic,’ a W.H.O. official says.
node.description: The World Health Organization said Europe was responsible for nearly three-fifths of the world’s recent coronavirus cases, and that deaths in the region were surging.

node.title: FDA's Plans for Molnupiravir COVID Pill Explained As U.K First Country To Approve Drug
node.description: In phase three trials the oral antiviral treatment was shown to reduce the risk of hospitalization and death in mild-to-moderate COVID cases by 50 percent.

node.title: AstraZeneca Pulls Application for Vaccine Approval in Switzerland Due to Age Restrictions
node.description: Switzerland imposed a rule that the AstraZeneca vaccine would only be available for those 50 and older.

node.title: Hopes Dim for Finding Survivors in Collapsed Nigerian High-Rise as Desperate Families Wait
node.description: A Nigerian Red Cross representative said "chances are very slim, very, very slim" that more survivors are in the rubble.

node.title: Joe Manchin Surrounded by Climate Protesters as He Steps Off Houseboat: 'We Want to Live'
node.description: The protesters called for the West Virginia senator to be removed from his position chairing the Energy and Natural Resources Committee.

node.title: Joe Manchin Will Back Paid Family Leave in Bill if It Meets This Condition
node.description: The West Virginia Senator has spoken about federal parental leave after House Speaker Nancy Pelosi reinserted it in the "Build Back Better Act."

node.title: Tiger King's Joe Exotic says he has 'aggressive cancer'
node.description: Joseph "Joe Exotic" Maldonado-Passage, who gained fame in the Netflix documentary Tiger King, posts a message to social media saying he has been diagnosed with "aggressive" prostate cancer.

node.title: FAA refers 37 unruly airline passengers to FBI
node.description: The FAA has also proposed more than $1 million in fines for bad behavior.

node.title: Democrats reintroduce paid leave in Build Back Better bill
node.description: The new version now contains a provision that had been dropped, paid leave, and also includes a tax break for wealthier Americans.

node.title: Effort to Reframe Climate Change as a Health Crisis Gains Steam
node.description: Research has increasingly shown that warming is taking a deadly toll on human health. At the global climate summit in Glasgow, the issue has gained new prominence.

node.title: In Spending Bill, Democrats Rely on Budget Gimmicks They Once Derided
node.description: Budget experts say true cost of legislation could be $4 trillion as lawmakers rely on sleights of hand to bring down the price tag.
